# Research Project 

The final version of the paper for the research project is due **Thurs, March 16, 17:00 PDT**.

Prior to the final paper being due there will be approximately weekly assignments in order to provide feedback, and allow you to immediately implement concepts and methods learned in the course. 

See [research project](research_project.html) page for instructions.

# Readings, Assignments, Lectures

Abbreviations used in the schedule:

- *r4ds*: Wickham and Groelmund, [R for Data Science](http://r4ds.had.co.nz/)
- *QSS*: Imai, *A First Course in Quantitative Social Science*
- *OpenIntro*: [OpenIntro Statistics, 3rd edition](https://www.openintro.org/stat/textbook.php?stat_book=os)
- *RealStats*: Bailey, *Real Stats*

### Lab (January 20th)

- *r4ds* [Ch 13: Relational data](http://r4ds.had.co.nz/relational-data.html). *This is the important chapter* Know and understand this well. Merging datasets
- *r4ds* [Ch 14: Strings](http://r4ds.had.co.nz/strings.html). You don't need to know all the details of regular expressions. But it is important to know they exist; if you need to search by a pattern---regular expressions are the way you do it. This is even useful when searching and replacing text in RStudio or other text editors.
